dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 910 IH: Biofuel Cell Research Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Feenstra (for himself, Mr. Flood, Mr. Finstad, and Mrs. Miller-Meeks) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology

form.official-title: To amend section 932 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 to create a biofuel and fuel cell vehicle research, development, and demonstration program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Biofuel Cell Research Act.

section.header: Biofuel and fuel cell vehicle research, development, and demonstration program
section.text: Section 932 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16232) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Biofuel and fuel cell vehicle research, development, and demonstration program

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall establish a research, development, and demonstration program for a commercially viable fuel cell system that uses biofuel as a fuel source for a vehicle.

The Secretary shall establish interim research and development goals that will result in the demonstration of commercially viable fuel cell systems that utilize biofuels as a fuel source, including the following:

subparagraph.text: Innovative stack designs and components, including—

clause.text: metal- or electrolyte-supported stack cell designs.

subparagraph.text: Variety of renewable energy sources, including ethanol and other biomass.
Technologies that enable fuel cell durability and fuel cell durability testing.
Systems designs and component integration that optimize efficiency, cost, transient response, and lifetime.

paragraph.text: In carrying out the activities under this section, the Secretary shall coordinate with—

subparagraph.text: appropriate Federal agencies, including the Department of Agriculture and the Department of Transportation;
relevant industry stakeholders, non-government organizations, and trade associations.
